Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "System.IO.IOException: Stream was too long error on .NET Core 2.0 application" (#244) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
In .NET Code 2 console application ([ConsoleApp1.zip](https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK/files/1309342/ConsoleApp1.zip)) writing a large Excel file stops with following error:
Unhandled Exception: System.IO.IOException: Stream was too long.
   at System.IO.MemoryStream.Write(Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 count)
   at System.IO.Compression.WrappedStream.Write(Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 count)
   at System.Xml.XmlUtf8RawTextWriter.FlushBuffer()
   at System.Xml.XmlUtf8RawTextWriter.WriteAttributeTextBlock(Char* pSrc, Char* pSrcEnd)
   at System.Xml.XmlUtf8RawTextWriter.WriteString(String text)
   at System.Xml.XmlWellFormedWriter.WriteString(String text)
   at DocumentFormat.OpenXml.OpenXmlElement.WriteAttributesTo(XmlWriter xmlWriter)
   at DocumentFormat.OpenXml.OpenXmlElement.WriteTo(XmlWriter xmlWriter)
   at DocumentFormat.OpenXml.OpenXmlPartWriter.WriteElement(OpenXmlElement elementObject)
   at ConsoleApp1.Program.WriteRandomValuesSAX(String fileName, String sheetName) in C:\Users\anton\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\ConsoleApplication2\ConsoleApp1\Program.cs:line 80
   at ConsoleApp1.Program.Main(String[] args) in C:\Users\anton\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\ConsoleApplication2\ConsoleApp1\Program.cs:line 105

And application workset size was growed up to 4 GiB. But it is x64 application, so process memory is not limited by 4GiB

Meanwhile in .NET FW4.7 same application ([ConsoleApp2.zip](https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK/files/1309348/ConsoleApp2.zip)) works perfectly with 10 MB workset size

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Merge styles with same name in DocumentBuilder" (#183) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
Solves #181.

Currently implemented with a compile-time feature flag, but this could easily be changed to an optional parameter passed to DocumentBuilder at run-time.

It is likely possible to clean up the section that maps style IDs in references and numberings so that it doesn't have to go through as many elements.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Reinstall NuGet packages in OpenXmlPowerToolsExamples projects" (#180) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
This commit completely removes all references to DocumentFormat.OpenXml
and System.IO.Packaging, some of which pointed to a local development
folder. This commit then reinstalls the DocumentFormat.OpenXml NuGet
package v2.7.2 from nuget.org.

For .NET Framework 4.5 and earlier, DocumentFormat.OpenXml no longer
uses System.IO.Packaging. For .NET Framework 4.6.1 and later,
DocumentFormat.OpenXml has a dependency on System.IO.Packaging, which
will get pulled from NuGet as required.

I've followed the [video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=otod1wXg8wI).
What are the next steps?
Are there instructions for building and running one of the [examples](https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools/tree/vNext/OpenXmlPowerToolsExamples) from start to finish?

Thanks

I've followed the [video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=otod1wXg8wI).

Thanks

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "DocumentBuilder doesn't handle multiple styles with the same style name but different IDs" (#181) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
**Observation 1**
When creating a document, `DocumentBuilder` merges styles by using the first style with a given ID from the list of sources. As an example, if source 1 and source 2 both specify a style with the ID `heading1`, the style from source 1 will be used.

**Observation 2**
When saving a document in a version of Word with a different display language than English, Word localizes the style IDs of built-in styles. However, it doesn't localize the style names. This leads to style XML like the following (from a Danish-language instance of Word):
```
<w:style w:type="paragraph" w:styleId="Overskrift1" xmlns:w="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/wordprocessingml/2006/main">
  <w:name w:val="heading 1" />
  <w:basedOn w:val="Normal" />
  <w:next w:val="Normal" />
  <w:link w:val="Overskrift1Tegn" />
  ...
</w:style>
```
**Observation 3**
When opening a document containing multiple (localized) styles with the same style name, Word deletes all but the last style, applying it to all elements that referenced one of the styles.

**Result**
Taken together, this means that `DocumentBuilder` seems to behave erratically with regards to style merging when building documents from sources saved in different language-versions of Word.

**Solution**
A possible solution would be to merge not only styles with the same ID, but also styles with the same name. This would mean that all references to one of the merged style would have to be changed to reference the ID of the "canonical" style.
